result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kristin Catherine Hilt

records.addlTxt: Pretrial 11-21-22 at 3:00 PM and Return date 1-11-23 at 9:00 AM

3:22 PM Defendant Kristin Catherine Hilt in court.  Attorney Steven James Sarbacker in court for Kristin Catherine Hilt.  Prosecuting attorney Margeret Anne Sorrentino in court for the State of Wisconsin. Right to preliminary hearing recited to defendant. Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over. Information filed, reading waived. Defendant stood mute. Court entered not guilty plea,State requested a pretrial and return date.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Return date scheduled for January 11, 2023 at 09:00 am.

10:17 AM Defendant Kristin Catherine Hilt in court.  Attorney Steven James Sarbacker in court for Kristin Catherine Hilt.  Attorney Brenda L. Yaskal in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Sarbacker requested a preliminary hearing. 10:18 AM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Plaintiffs Motion and Demand for Discovery and Notice of DNA and Witness List filed by Atty Yaskal
